Speaker: julia
Dialogue: We're going to freeze to death.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: It's just been empty a while.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: How long since you were here?

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: The best part of ten years.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I wanted to sell it off at one point, after the old Lady died, but I couldn't get Frank to agree.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Why didn't he want to sell it?

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I don't know. Probably wanted a hideaway.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I thought half of it was your brother's?

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: He won't complain.  He can pay off some of his creditors.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: You know we have to let Kirsty see this place, before we do anything to it.  She'll love it.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: You wanted to come back to London.  We came back.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: He's been here.  There's stuff in the kitchen.  He must have made a hasty exit.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I said: I found a room.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: No, no.  Not just yet.  It needs ... er ... some work.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I'm not going to change my mind, Dad.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Maybe tomorrow.  I got to go look for a job.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Alright, let's give it another try.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: How are you doing through there?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: It looks like a bomb's dropped.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I'll show you around when we've got this damn bed moved.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Upstairs.  Treat her gently, huh?  She hates moving.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: O.K.  I'll be nice.  You get on with the muscle work.  I'll make myself some coffee.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Damn right.  Now are we going to move the bed or not?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Well can I come in or not?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  Of course.  You're very welcome.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: That's nice to know.  Have you got a towel?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: There's a towel in the bath- room.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Did Dad tell you I got a room, by the way?  Waterloo.  Centre of the known universe.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I don't want to see the dress.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Oh my God.  Oh my God.  Oh my God.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Will you take the weight while I take a step up?

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I don't know, I haven't looked. You know me and blood.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: It's probably going to need stitches.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Just an accident.  He's all right.  Will you drive?  He needs stitches.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: The keys are in the kitchen.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: - always hated the sight of my own blood.  I go out like a light. Anybody else's?  no problem.  But mine ... you know ... goes straight to my head.  Anyhow, this damn doctor's poking around and I'm saying: I'm going to pass out, and he's saying, no you're not, no you're not.  Next thing I know -

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: - I wake up On the floor.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I know.  And he's saying: I'm sorry.  I'm sorry.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Come on, you're only young once -

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I won't be able to stand.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Would you excuse me?  I think I'm going to go to bed.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: Christ.  I think it's time we were away -

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Bill?  Absolutely not.  Sit down.  We've got celebrating to do.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Oh it was.  It was wonderful.

Speaker: evelyn
Dialogue: Yes.  You must.  We're so happy you're back.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Believe me.  It's me.  It's really me.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: His blood ... on the floor ... It brought me back.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Just help, will you?  Please God, help me -

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You can't let me stay like this. Please.  You can't.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: What do you want me to do.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: The blood brought me this far. I need more of the same.  Or I'll slip back ...

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: You know I do know the way home.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Please.  I want to see you home.  All right?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: What do we do if there isn't?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Why don't you stay at Larry's house?  There's plenty of room.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Yeah, there's room.  And there's Julia.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Oh, I don't know.  Up-tight. Frigid.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Well you've just been talking to the wrong people.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I just called in.  How about tonight?

Speaker: prudhoe
Dialogue: I try not to drink at lunch- time.  Makes me sleepy in the afternoon.  You like to keep a clear head, eh?  I do it anyway.  No will-power. Got a busy afternoon?

Speaker: prudhoe
Dialogue: You know it's not often I ... you know ...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: There's a first time for every- thing.

Speaker: prudhoe
Dialogue: I'm already way over my usual limit.  You know, it's funny. I feel like I've known you for years.

Speaker: prudhoe
Dialogue: Oh, come on.  It's what you brought me here for, isn't it?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Yes.  I just think we'd be better off upstairs.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Come on in.  Make yourself at home.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Why don't you take off your jacket? You're warm.

Speaker: prudhoe
Dialogue: Why don't you do the same?

Speaker: prudhoe
Dialogue: You know you are.  Loveliest woman I ever set eyes on.

Speaker: prudhoe
Dialogue: Too much drink.  Better empty my bladder.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: See?   It's making me whole again.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Come to Daddy.  I only want to touch ...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I'll be O.K.  Just leave me be a while.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I'll be down in a minute

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: My nerves ... are beginning to work again.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: The Cenobites.  It's only a matter of time before they find I've slipped them. I have to get away from here.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Just a moment.  Put on some music will you babe?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Ssh. Don't want babe to hear.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You won't cheat me will you? You'll stay with me.  Help me. Then we can be together, the way we were before.  We belong to each other now, for better or worse ...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I'm O.K., honey.  It's all right ...

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I just wanted to be sure you were O.K.

Speaker: victim
Dialogue: You're sure we're not going to be interrupted -

Speaker: victim
Dialogue: Only I like to be careful.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Better.  Much better.  I'd like some clothes.  And maybe a cigarette.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Then you tell me ... you explain what happened to you?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: That's what they call themselves. They're not human.  Maybe they were once, but they're not now. They rearrange their own flesh for pleasure.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: It cost me a fortune.  All I had.  It's a puzzle you see. You solve it, and the Cenobites come through ...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: God knows.  Sometimes I think they're just behind the walls ...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Oh no.  They kept to their bargain.  They gave me experiences I'd never forget ...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: But their pleasure was my pain.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: And the blood let you out?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: There are ways to resurrection. Blood's one of them.  I won't let them take me back, Julia.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I want to be whole, and then get out -

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: You won't have to.  We'll be gone.  Somewhere they'll never find us.

Speaker: commentator
Dialogue: - and now he's in trouble, he's really in trouble -

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Maybe I left a window open -

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: ...I love you, honey ... let me ... oh God ... I love you ...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: No.  No, you mustn't.  PLEASE. No.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I don't understand you.  One moment you're all over me, the next it's:  Don't touch me.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: ... maybe we should never have come back.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Maybe you should give it some time.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: She's not like Mom.  She's ... I don't know ... moody.  I thought that was what you liked about her.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: You don't like her at all do you?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I don't know her.  She's so ... sealed up.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: She doesn't even want to leave the house.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: It's like she's waiting for something.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I don't know.  I don't know. It's beyond me.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Would you ... maybe call round sometime?  Try to make friends.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Maybe all she needs is some company.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Then find me somebody else, before they come looking.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Please ... don't let him kill me ... please ...

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Keep your fucking distance. Julia!  Where's Julia?  Christ, what have you done with her.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Kirsty.  It's Frank.  It's Uncle Frank.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: No.  Get the fuck off me.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Don't touch me.  Or so help me -

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What?  What will you do?  What can you do?  There's nothing to be frightened of.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I bet you make your Daddy proud, don't you?  Beautiful.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I used to tell myself that. Used to try and pretend I was dreaming all the pain.  But why kid yourself?  Some things have to be endured.  Take it from me. And that makes the pleasures so much sweeter ...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: One last time.  Give me the box.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Some things have to be endured ...

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: You took quite a beating.  Do you remember what happened?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I want to speak to my father ...

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Of course.  We'll bring you a telephone.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Chin up.  There's no serious damage.  And you're safe here.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I don't think so.  She'll want Larry first.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: That's probably her now.  Or the police.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: There's very little I can do about it.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Like this?  Look at me! LIKE THIS?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Well we can't just stay here -

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I need a skin.  Then we leave -

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: He's probably got a meeting. I called a friend of mine.  He's coming; is that O.K.?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I don't know where to begin ...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: It's better you see for your- self -

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Where the hell did you come from?

Speaker: cenobite
Dialogue: The box ... you opened it. We came.

Speaker: cenobite
Dialogue: It's a means to summon us - it's called the Lament Con- figuration.

Speaker: cenobite
Dialogue: Cenobites.  Explorers in the further regions of experience. Demons to some.  Angels to others.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Well, I didn't mean to open that thing.  You can go back wherever you came from.

Speaker: cenobite
Dialogue: You solved the box.  We came. Now you must come with us. Taste our pleasures.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: These THINGS ... they want to take me -

Speaker: cenobite
Dialogue: He doesn't see us, or hear us. We belong to you, Kirsty.  And you to us.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Don't let them take me, Steve -

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I won't let anybody take you.

Speaker: female cenobite
Dialogue: If he takes another step, we open his throat.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Just go.  PLEASE.  I'll be O.K. I'm going to go see Dad.  He'll look after me -

Speaker: cenobite
Dialogue: No tears please.  It's a waste of good suffering.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: To a man called Frank Cotton?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: HE did.  I've seen him.  He's alive.

Speaker: cenobite
Dialogue: Is that so?   And what are you proposing?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I'll take you to him.  Then you take him instead of me.  Back wherever you come from.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: I'd better go look for her.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Maybe she's gone back to her -

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Please!   Dad!   It's me! It's Kirsty!

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I have to see my father.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Of course.  There's no need to shout.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: You look terrible.  Have you had an accident?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I don't follow. What was there to see?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Oh God.  Thank God.  I thought something might have ...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: It's all right, sweetheart. Julia's told me everything; and it's all right ...

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: No.  You don't understand. Your brother - Frank - he's here in the house.  And he's -

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Whatever Frank did was his error. And it's finished with now.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: He was insane, baby:  a mad dog. I put him out of his misery -

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I'll go to the police, when I'm feeling stronger.  Try and find some way to make them understand, though God knows I don't really understand myself.  Did he hurt you?

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Poor Frank.  He's better off dead.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: You leave this to us, you hear me?   We'll deal with the police -

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: - it's all right.   Really it is ...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Help me, Frank. For God's sake.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Got in downstairs.  Looking for you.  What's going on?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Don't cry for him.  He's dead. He always was.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Go on.   Kill me.  I don't care.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Hush now.   It's all right. Frank's here.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: That's right.  Are you losing your mind, baby?  This is Frank you're talking to.  FRANK.

Speaker: female cenobite
Dialogue: We had to hear it from his own lips -

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You set me up!   You bitch. You set me up!

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: We have to get out of here. They'll kill us for the fun of it.

Speaker: female cenobite
Dialogue: We've got such sights to show you -
